nodes.text: Bounty Hunters Guild Museum and Library

The Bounty Hunters Guild Museum and Library was a location owned by the Bounty Hunters' Guild which acted as a museum and a library for members of the organization. The building held thousands of bounty hunters' biographies, as well as instructional datatapes, all meant for use as a learning resources for bounty hunters in the Guild. The Rodian Kenek Weeyo worked as Chief Custodian of the Museum and Library for many years, and at some point following the fall of the Jedi Order, contributed a chapter to The Bounty Hunter Code, a manual given to all guild members, in which he encouraged visits to the building.

The Bounty Hunters Guild Museum and Library was first mentioned in The Bounty Hunter Code: From the Files of Boba Fett, a reference book written by Jason Fry, Daniel Wallace and Ryder Windham in 2014.
